  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach public void setUp()

    • testAddE

      @Test @DisplayName("add(E)") public void testAddE()
      Tests the DoublingList.add(E) method.
      1. Adds to an empty list.
      2. Adds to the end of a list.
      3. Attempts to add null to the list, catches the exception.

    • testAddIntE

      @Test @DisplayName("add(int, E)") public void testAddIntE()
      Tests the DoublingList.add(int, E) method.
      1. Adds to an empty list.
      2. Adds to the end of a list.
      3. Adds to the front of a list.
      4. Adds to the middle of a list.
      5. Tests the scenarios from figures 4 â€” 9 in the project spec.
      6. Attempts to add null to the list, catches the exception.

    • testRemove

      @Test @DisplayName("remove(int)") public void testRemove()
      Tests the DoublingList.remove(int) method:
      1. Tests figure 10 from the project spec:
        • Deleting from the beginning of a node.
        • Deleting from the end of a node.
      2. Tests figure 11 from the project spec:
        • Deleting resulting in list resizing
      3. Tests removing an out-of-bounds index (both -1 and some value >= size)

    • testSize

      @Test @DisplayName("size()") public void testSize()
      Tests the DoublingList.size() method.
      1. Adds to a list and checks that the size has increased by 1
      2. Removes from a list and checks that the size has decreased by 1

    • testToStringInternal

      @Test @DisplayName("toStringInternal()") public void testToStringInternal()
      Tests the DoublingList.toStringInternal() method. Adds and removes various elements to/from the list and ensures that the list's structure is correctly represented by the returned String.

    • testToStringInternalListIterator

      @Test @DisplayName("toStringInternal(ListIterator)") public void testToStringInternalListIterator()
      Tests the DoublingList.toStringInternal(ListIterator) method. Iterates through the list, ensuring that the cursor is correctly represented. Ensures these new elements are represented in the String representation returned.

    • testListIteratorNextAndHasNext

      @Test @DisplayName("DoublingListIterator.next() and DoublingListIterator.hasNext()") public void testListIteratorNextAndHasNext()
      Tests the DoublingList.DoublingListIterator.next() and the DoublingList.DoublingListIterator.hasNext() methods. Iterates through the list, checking that each call to next() returns the expected value from the list. Also ensures hasNext() is accurate. Checks for a NoSuchElementException when expected.

    • testListIteratorPreviousAndHasPrevious

      @Test @DisplayName("DoublingListIterator.prevous() and DoublingListIterator.hasPrevious()") public void testListIteratorPreviousAndHasPrevious()
      Tests the DoublingList.DoublingListIterator.previous() and the DoublingList.DoublingListIterator.hasPrevious() methods. Iterates backwards through the list, checking that each call to previous() returns the expected value from the list. Also ensures hasPrevious() is accurate. Checks for a NoSuchElementException when expected.

    • testListIteratorNextIndexAndPreviousIndex

      @Test @DisplayName("DoublingListIterator.nextIndex() and DoublingListIterator.previousIndex()") public void testListIteratorNextIndexAndPreviousIndex()
      Tests the DoublingList.DoublingListIterator.nextIndex() and the DoublingList.DoublingListIterator.previousIndex() methods. Iterates through the list, checking that each call to nextIndex() returns the expected index. Also ensures previousIndex() is accurate.

    • testListIteratorAdd

      @Test @DisplayName("DoublingListIterator.add()") public void testListIteratorAdd()
      Tests the DoublingList.DoublingListIterator.add(E) method. Adds items to the list, ensuring that previous() returns them. Tries adding a null value.

    • testListIteratorRemove

      @Test @DisplayName("DoublingListIterator.remove()") public void testListIteratorRemove()
      Tests the DoublingList.DoublingListIterator.remove() method. Removes items from the list, ensuring that the correct items were removed based on which method was called first. Also tries to call remove() without calling a required method before.

    • testListIteratorSet

      @Test @DisplayName("DoublingListIterator.set(E)") public void testListIteratorSet()
      Tests the DoublingList.DoublingListIterator.set(E) method. Invokes set() after calling next() and previous(), ensuring the element is set in the correct place. Also tries to call set(E) without calling a required method before.
